paragraphs.name: ae2f
paragraphs.text:
Don’t Care About What People Think
We all die in the end, do you really think it matters what people think of you?

paragraphs.name: 5eae
paragraphs.text:
Spend Time With People You Love
That’s your family and best friends. If you don’t have a family, create one. Most people in life are only visitors. Family is for life.
“I know one thing: that I know nothing.”

Keep A Journal
No, keeping a journal is not for children. It helps you to become a better thinker and writer. “I don’t want to be a writer” you might think. Well, how many emails and texts do you send a day? Everybody is a writer.
paragraphs.name: ef00

paragraphs.text:
Avoid Negative Situations And People
You can’t underestimate the impact others have on you. Get away from negativity at all cost.
paragraphs.name: d88d

paragraphs.text: Last week I turned 30. Unlike most people, I do like getting older. 10 years ago, I was a complete idiot.
paragraphs.name: 4bf5

paragraphs.text:
Rely On Yourself 
Because it’s the best feeling in the world to know you can figure things out by yourself. But don’t overdo it. Ask for help when you need it.
paragraphs.name: b611

paragraphs.text:
Money Isn’t Important 
It really isn’t. But you have to train yourself not to care about money. Don’t become too dependent on the stuff you own — otherwise, the stuff will own you. Live below your means.
paragraphs.name: 8ba5

paragraphs.text:
Don’t Start A Relationship If You’re Not In Love
I’ve done this more than once. You kind of like someone and think: “We might as well give it a shot.” Not a good idea. You’re either in love, or you are not. Don’t fool yourself. It’s not fair to you and the other person.
paragraphs.name: cedd

paragraphs.text:
Things Are Not What They Seem
If something sounds too good to be true, it is. A little skepticism never hurts.
paragraphs.name: fd0a

paragraphs.text: So much wisdom!
paragraphs.name: 34e8

paragraphs.text: Darius. I couldn’t agree more. I think this is why so many of the older generation are less self conscious. They realise that all the small quirks we suppress (that make us who we are) can attract occasional quizzical glances and a frown or two but mean very little outside of that split second from a life of days, months and years.
paragraphs.name: aa69

paragraphs.text: Great piece! Thanks for sharing.
paragraphs.name: d94c

9a7d34b33cb1.title: This resonates with me so much! 26 and only just working some of these things out!

paragraphs.text: This resonates with me so much! 26 and only just working some of these things out!
paragraphs.name: df20

paragraphs.text: Excellent, excellent list. However, I must disagree with this one: “Don’t Start A Relationship If You’re Not In Love”
paragraphs.name: df7c

paragraphs.text: Arranged marriages have a higher success rate than romantically-formed marriages. I’m not advocating arranged marriage, but I’m illustrating that love is much more of a choice than it is a feeling.
paragraphs.name: f7f4

paragraphs.name: 525c

ce941dde452c.title: Negativity in others isn’t always to be fled from, though.

paragraphs.text: Negativity in others isn’t always to be fled from, though. If someone you care about is suffering from depression, for example, it’s not particularly noble to cut them out of your life because they’re bringing you down. Helping the unhappy is messy business, just like helping the physically unwell, and some of the mess may get on you. But it is an admirable thing to do.
paragraphs.name: cbd9

paragraphs.text: Thank you for writing this.
paragraphs.name: 81e4

paragraphs.text: This resonates a lot, especially the creating part where, one thing to do for us to feel better, is to give out a piece of us through creation. Otherwise you’ll feel lousy.
paragraphs.name: 5e7a

paragraphs.text: And of course, no. 30: taking action. All ideas are useless if not acted upon. This has been a challenge throughout my life and will be.

cce5117d640c.title: I would add that if you decide to have kids, be prepared to question everything you think you know.

paragraphs.text: I would add that if you decide to have kids, be prepared to question everything you think you know. Most parents divide their life timelines into “Before Kids” and “After Kids,” and it has nothing to do with your age or previous life experience.

59eab4455e4.title: Pick an industry, not a job.

paragraphs.text: Pick an industry, not a job. Brilliant advice. Also, rest before you are tired. If only everyone would learn that one. Keeps you fresh and ready for the next challenge. We don’t get any kudos, ten years on, for working overtime and wearing ourselves out prematurely.
paragraphs.name: 333a
